com.nobigsoftware.dfalex

Class Nfa<MATCHRESULT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nobigsoftware.dfalex.Nfa<MATCHRESULT>

  • public class Nfa<MATCHRESULT>
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple non-deterministic finite automaton (NFA) representation

    A set of Matchable patterns is converted to an NFA as an intermediate step toward creating the DFA.

    You can also build an NFA directly with this class and convert it to a DFA with DfaBuilder.buildFromNfa(Nfa, int[], DfaAmbiguityResolver, com.nobigsoftware.util.BuilderCache).

    See NFA on Wikipedia

    • Method Detail

      • numStates

        public int numStates()
        Get the number of states in the NFA
        Returns:
        the total number of states that have been added with addState(Object)

      • addState

        public int addState(MATCHRESULT accept)
        Add a new state to the NFA
        Parameters:
        accept - if non-null, then the NFA will produce this result for any string that reaches the new state
        Returns:
        the number of the new state

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(int from,
                          int to,
                          char firstChar,
                          char lastChar)
        Add a transition to the NFA

        A new transition will be created from state from to state to for all characters with code points in [from,to] (inclusive)

        Parameters:
        from - the number of the state to transition from
        to - the number of the state to transition to, for characters in the accepted range
        firstChar - the first character in the accepted range
        lastChar - the last character in the accepted range

      • addEpsilon

        public void addEpsilon(int from,
                       int to)
        Add an epsilon transition to the NFA

        An epsilon transition is created from state from to state to.

        This will cause any string that is accepted by to to be accepted by from as well

        Parameters:
        from - the number of the state to transition from
        to - the number of the state to transition to

      • getAccept

        public MATCHRESULT getAccept(int state)
        Get the result attached to the given state
        Parameters:
        state - the state number
        Returns:
        the result that was provided to addState(Object) when the state was created

      • hasTransitionsOrAccepts

        public boolean hasTransitionsOrAccepts(int state)
        Check whether a state has any non-epsilon transitions or has a result attached
        Parameters:
        state - the state number
        Returns:
        true if the state has any transitions or accepts

      • getStateEpsilons

        public java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> getStateEpsilons(int state)
        Get all the epsilon transitions from a state
        Parameters:
        state - the state number
        Returns:
        An iterable over all transitions out of the given state

      • getStateTransitions

        public java.lang.Iterable<NfaTransition> getStateTransitions(int state)
        Get all the non-epsilon transitions from a state
        Parameters:
        state - the state number
        Returns:
        An iterable over all transitions out of the given state

      • Disemptify

        public int Disemptify(int state)
        Make modified state, if necessary, that doesn't match the empty string

        If state has a non-null result attached, or can reach such a state through epsilon transitions, then a DFA made from that state would match the empty string. In that case a new NFA state will be created that matches all the same strings except the empty string.

        Parameters:
        state - the number of the state to disemptify
        Returns:
        If state matches the empty string, then a new state that does not match the empty string is returned. Otherwise state is returned.
